4766.title: As introduced, exempts farms where rabbit is slaughtered and processed and the meat is sold directly to consumers from permitting requirements for retail food stores. - Amends TCA Title 53 and Title 68, Chapter 14, Part 7.
4766.description: As introduced, exempts farms where rabbit is slaughtered and processed and the meat is sold directly to consumers from permitting requirements for retail food stores. - Amends TCA Title 53 and Title 68, Chapter 14, Part 7.

4777.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Commerce & Labor Committee
4777.title: As introduced, prohibits a person who owns a partial interest in a hoofed mammal from using the milk of the animal for the person's personal consumption or other personal use. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 3.
4777.description: As introduced, prohibits a person who owns a partial interest in a hoofed mammal from using the milk of the animal for the person's personal consumption or other personal use. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 3.

4779.title: As introduced, removes requirement that 52 percent of the 5 percent commission retained by county registers for collecting and reporting recordation tax must be remitted to state treasurer and credited to state general fund. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.
4779.description: As introduced, removes requirement that 52 percent of the 5 percent commission retained by county registers for collecting and reporting recordation tax must be remitted to state treasurer and credited to state general fund. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.

4792.title: As introduced, expands, from five days to 10 days, the time period in which members of the board of water quality, oil, and gas must be notified of meetings to review permit matters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3.
4792.description: As introduced, expands, from five days to 10 days, the time period in which members of the board of water quality, oil, and gas must be notified of meetings to review permit matters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3.

4793.title: As introduced, prohibits the death penalty as a punishment for defendants suffering from severe mental illness at the time of the offense. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
4793.description: As introduced, prohibits the death penalty as a punishment for defendants suffering from severe mental illness at the time of the offense. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

4800.title: As introduced, enacts the "Affordable Real Property Act." - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 23; Title 67, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
4800.description: As introduced, enacts the "Affordable Real Property Act." - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 23; Title 67, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

4821.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Judiciary Committee
4821.title: As introduced, allows a court to sentence a person to an individually assessed sentence based on community rehabilitation with a focus on parent-child unity and support, if the person has been convicted of a nonviolent offense and is the primary caretaker of a dependent child. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.
4821.description: As introduced, allows a court to sentence a person to an individually assessed sentence based on community rehabilitation with a focus on parent-child unity and support, if the person has been convicted of a nonviolent offense and is the primary caretaker of a dependent child. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.

4823.title: As introduced, establishes plastic-free initiative program; creates the plastic pollution advisory council to administer the program. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68, Chapter 211, Part 8.
4823.description: As introduced, establishes plastic-free initiative program; creates the plastic pollution advisory council to administer the program. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68, Chapter 211, Part 8.

4828.title: As introduced, creates a task force to study and review the management and operation of state mental health facilities. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 33.
4828.description: As introduced, creates a task force to study and review the management and operation of state mental health facilities. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 33.

4839.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate State & Local Government Committee
4839.title: As introduced, changes the definition of a "detainee day" for purposes of compensating a county for holding a state prisoner from the date the prisoner is sentenced to the department of correction to the date the prisoner is convicted by the trial court; and allows commissioner to retroactively compensate a county back to the initial date of incarceration if the trial judge grants the prisoner credit for time served and time spent in jail pending appeal. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 8.
4839.description: As introduced, changes the definition of a "detainee day" for purposes of compensating a county for holding a state prisoner from the date the prisoner is sentenced to the department of correction to the date the prisoner is convicted by the trial court; and allows commissioner to retroactively compensate a county back to the initial date of incarceration if the trial judge grants the prisoner credit for time served and time spent in jail pending appeal. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 8.

4924.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
4924.title: As introduced, requires the board of chiropractic examiners to post the names of X-ray operators who hold a current certificate of proficiency on the board’s website. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 4.
4924.description: As introduced, requires the board of chiropractic examiners to post the names of X-ray operators who hold a current certificate of proficiency on the board’s website. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 4.

4965.title: As introduced, changes from February 15 to February 1 the date by which the Tennessee agricultural hall of fame board must deliver a report of the board's activities for the previous two years to the chair of the agriculture and natural resources committee of the house of representatives and the chair of the energy, agriculture and natural resources committee of the senate. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 39; Title 43; Title 44; Title 53; Title 67 and Title 68.
4965.description: As introduced, changes from February 15 to February 1 the date by which the Tennessee agricultural hall of fame board must deliver a report of the board's activities for the previous two years to the chair of the agriculture and natural resources committee of the house of representatives and the chair of the energy, agriculture and natural resources committee of the senate. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 39; Title 43; Title 44; Title 53; Title 67 and Title 68.

4973.title: As introduced, extends state employee defense protections to nonprofit organizations that partner with the state to provide foster home care for children in the care and custody of the state. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 9.
4973.description: As introduced, extends state employee defense protections to nonprofit organizations that partner with the state to provide foster home care for children in the care and custody of the state. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 9.

4978.title: As introduced, limits the number of patients assigned to a nursing assistant at a nursing home to no more than 10. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.
4978.description: As introduced, limits the number of patients assigned to a nursing assistant at a nursing home to no more than 10. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.

4981.last_action: Recalled from Senate State & Local Government Committee
4981.title: As introduced, allows persons, firms, or corporations who hold a valid license or permit to sell wine at retail to apply for a direct shipper's license to be able to ship wine to consumers in this state. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.
4981.description: As introduced, allows persons, firms, or corporations who hold a valid license or permit to sell wine at retail to apply for a direct shipper's license to be able to ship wine to consumers in this state. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.

4983.title: As introduced, raises the threshold of contributions, from $30,000 to $50,000, under which a charitable organization is not required to file a registration statement and fee with the secretary of state in order to solicit contributions. - Amends TCA Section 48-101-502.
4983.description: As introduced, raises the threshold of contributions, from $30,000 to $50,000, under which a charitable organization is not required to file a registration statement and fee with the secretary of state in order to solicit contributions. - Amends TCA Section 48-101-502.

4990.title: As introduced, gives sole authority to request an autopsy to the district attorney general for each county; removes authority for county medical examiner to request an autopsy. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 7, Part 1.
4990.description: As introduced, gives sole authority to request an autopsy to the district attorney general for each county; removes authority for county medical examiner to request an autopsy. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 7, Part 1.

4991.title: As introduced, authorizes a county legislative body to disapprove automatic pay increases for county officials based on annual increases in salary for state employees by a two-thirds majority vote of the members entitled to vote. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 24.
4991.description: As introduced, authorizes a county legislative body to disapprove automatic pay increases for county officials based on annual increases in salary for state employees by a two-thirds majority vote of the members entitled to vote. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 24.

4992.title: As introduced, requires the senate judiciary committee and the house civil justice committee to conduct at least one joint, public hearing on the judicial redistricting plan proposed by the advisory task force to review composition of judicial districts; requires the general assembly to take legislative action to adopt or reject the plan before adjourning the 111th general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 8, Chapter 7; Title 16; Title 17; Title 18, Chapter 4 and Title 18, Chapter 5.
4992.description: As introduced, requires the senate judiciary committee and the house civil justice committee to conduct at least one joint, public hearing on the judicial redistricting plan proposed by the advisory task force to review composition of judicial districts; requires the general assembly to take legislative action to adopt or reject the plan before adjourning the 111th general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 8, Chapter 7; Title 16; Title 17; Title 18, Chapter 4 and Title 18, Chapter 5.

5173.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate State & Local Government Committee
5173.title: As introduced, removes, effective January 1, 2021, provision making it permissive for Shelby County to hold nonpartisan elections for state trial court judgeships and county judicial offices and requires elections for state trial court judgeships and county judicial offices to be conducted in a nonpartisan manner in Davidson and Shelby counties; requires the incumbent officeholder be listed first on the ballot if the incumbent qualifies for the election. - Amends TCA Title 2.
5173.description: As introduced, removes, effective January 1, 2021, provision making it permissive for Shelby County to hold nonpartisan elections for state trial court judgeships and county judicial offices and requires elections for state trial court judgeships and county judicial offices to be conducted in a nonpartisan manner in Davidson and Shelby counties; requires the incumbent officeholder be listed first on the ballot if the incumbent qualifies for the election. - Amends TCA Title 2.

5210.title: As introduced, establishes a preference and rebuttable presumption for joint custody or shared parenting, but gives the court wide discretion to order a custody arrangement in the child's best interest; requires the court to include findings of fact and conclusions of law to the contrary in any custody order that does not include joint custody. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.
5210.description: As introduced, establishes a preference and rebuttable presumption for joint custody or shared parenting, but gives the court wide discretion to order a custody arrangement in the child's best interest; requires the court to include findings of fact and conclusions of law to the contrary in any custody order that does not include joint custody. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.

5217.title: As introduced, extends from five to seven days the amount of time after sending a certified letter to the issuer of a worthless check that it may be inferred notice of the worthless check was received for purposes of determining the issuer’s fraudulent intent or knowledge of insufficient funds. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
5217.description: As introduced, extends from five to seven days the amount of time after sending a certified letter to the issuer of a worthless check that it may be inferred notice of the worthless check was received for purposes of determining the issuer’s fraudulent intent or knowledge of insufficient funds. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

5462.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Finance, Ways & Means Committee
5462.title: As introduced, adds state appropriations made to charitable organizations under contract with the department of children's services that provide social services to types of appropriations protected by state's sovereign immunity. - Amends TCA Section 9-1-103.
5462.description: As introduced, adds state appropriations made to charitable organizations under contract with the department of children's services that provide social services to types of appropriations protected by state's sovereign immunity. - Amends TCA Section 9-1-103.

5464.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Judiciary Committee
5464.title: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Disclaimer of Property Interests Act." - Amends TCA Title 31; Title 34; Title 35 and Title 45.
5464.description: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Disclaimer of Property Interests Act." - Amends TCA Title 31; Title 34; Title 35 and Title 45.

5622.last_action: Rcvd. from S., held on H. desk.
5622.title: As introduced, authorizes the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption at the Historic Jackson Theater, the Jonesborough Repertory Theatre, the International Storytelling Center, the McKinney Center, the Jonesborough Visitor Center, the Historic Eureka Inn, and the AmericInn Lodge and Suites, all located in Jonesborough. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
5622.description: As introduced, authorizes the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption at the Historic Jackson Theater, the Jonesborough Repertory Theatre, the International Storytelling Center, the McKinney Center, the Jonesborough Visitor Center, the Historic Eureka Inn, and the AmericInn Lodge and Suites, all located in Jonesborough. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

5658.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Commerce & Labor Committee
5658.title: As introduced, increases the time within which an employer must document the basis of reasonable-suspicion drug or alcohol testing by an employer who runs a drug-free workplace from 24 hours to 30 hours. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Section 49-6-4213; Title 50; Section 63-1-126 and Title 71.
5658.description: As introduced, increases the time within which an employer must document the basis of reasonable-suspicion drug or alcohol testing by an employer who runs a drug-free workplace from 24 hours to 30 hours. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Section 49-6-4213; Title 50; Section 63-1-126 and Title 71.

5659.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Judiciary Committee
5659.title: As introduced, authorizes aggrieved parties to demand a jury in judicial review of an administrative hearing under the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act and in cases for a permanent injunction or forfeiture under the Tennessee Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act. - Amends TCA Section 3-6-204; Title 4; Section 8-3-102; Title 27; Title 29; Section 36-5-1003; Section 36-5-1107; Section 37-5-514; Section 39-17-1509; Section 40-33-213; Section 42-2-224; Section 47-9-513; Section 49-1-1107; Title 53; Section 55-12-103; Section 55-17-116; Section 55-10-425; Section 60-1-401; Title 65; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 13; Section 68-120-110; Section 68-201-116; Section 68-212-113; Section 68-212-114; Section 68-212-215; Section 68-221-714; Section 68-1-104; Section 69-3-115; Section 69-11-118; Section 71-3-510; Section 71-4-507 and Section 71-3-509.
5659.description: As introduced, authorizes aggrieved parties to demand a jury in judicial review of an administrative hearing under the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act and in cases for a permanent injunction or forfeiture under the Tennessee Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act. - Amends TCA Section 3-6-204; Title 4; Section 8-3-102; Title 27; Title 29; Section 36-5-1003; Section 36-5-1107; Section 37-5-514; Section 39-17-1509; Section 40-33-213; Section 42-2-224; Section 47-9-513; Section 49-1-1107; Title 53; Section 55-12-103; Section 55-17-116; Section 55-10-425; Section 60-1-401; Title 65; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 13; Section 68-120-110; Section 68-201-116; Section 68-212-113; Section 68-212-114; Section 68-212-215; Section 68-221-714; Section 68-1-104; Section 69-3-115; Section 69-11-118; Section 71-3-510; Section 71-4-507 and Section 71-3-509.

5663.title: As introduced, allows dogs in barber shops; requires annual inspections of barber shops and barber schools to include inspection of the sterilization of clippers and other such equipment used on customers. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 3.
5663.description: As introduced, allows dogs in barber shops; requires annual inspections of barber shops and barber schools to include inspection of the sterilization of clippers and other such equipment used on customers. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 3.

5688.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Commerce & Labor Committee
5688.title: As introduced, extends the number of days a business may advertise that it is going out of business from 90 to 120 days. - Amends TCA Title 47.
5688.description: As introduced, extends the number of days a business may advertise that it is going out of business from 90 to 120 days. - Amends TCA Title 47.

5710.title: As introduced, requires employers to pay minimum wages to employees, starting with $10.00 per hour effective January 1, 2020, and increased by $1.00 per hour for the next two years to achieve a minimum wage of $12.00 beginning January 1, 2022. - Amends TCA Title 50.
5710.description: As introduced, requires employers to pay minimum wages to employees, starting with $10.00 per hour effective January 1, 2020, and increased by $1.00 per hour for the next two years to achieve a minimum wage of $12.00 beginning January 1, 2022. - Amends TCA Title 50.

5724.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate State & Local Government Committee
5724.title: As introduced, prohibits a polling official or polling place worker or volunteer from making any inquiries or requiring any documentation or other evidence regarding a person's citizenship at a polling station if the person presents a valid voter registration card and appropriate evidence of identification authorizing the person to vote at the polling station. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.
5724.description: As introduced, prohibits a polling official or polling place worker or volunteer from making any inquiries or requiring any documentation or other evidence regarding a person's citizenship at a polling station if the person presents a valid voter registration card and appropriate evidence of identification authorizing the person to vote at the polling station. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

5730.title: As introduced, authorizes civil action against a person selling or transferring a firearm if the firearm is sold or transferred to another person who uses the firearm in a crime resulting in injury to persons or property or in wrongful death. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
5730.description: As introduced, authorizes civil action against a person selling or transferring a firearm if the firearm is sold or transferred to another person who uses the firearm in a crime resulting in injury to persons or property or in wrongful death. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

5778.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5778.title: As introduced, directs the comptroller of the treasury to study the economic impact to the state and local governments as the result of the passage and approval of chapter 973 of the Public Acts of 2018 regarding sanctuary policies, and to report to the senate state and local committee and the state government committee and local government committee of the house of representatives by January 30, 2020. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
5778.description: As introduced, directs the comptroller of the treasury to study the economic impact to the state and local governments as the result of the passage and approval of chapter 973 of the Public Acts of 2018 regarding sanctuary policies, and to report to the senate state and local committee and the state government committee and local government committee of the house of representatives by January 30, 2020. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

5910.title: As introduced, requires each municipality to maintain a list of all properties located within the municipality's boundaries that are designated as national historic landmarks and properties listed on the national register of historic places. - Amends TCA Title 6 and Title 7.
5910.description: As introduced, requires each municipality to maintain a list of all properties located within the municipality's boundaries that are designated as national historic landmarks and properties listed on the national register of historic places. - Amends TCA Title 6 and Title 7.

5966.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
5966.title: As introduced, creates an exception to the two-hour biennial continuing education requirement related to controlled substance prescribing for licensed prescribers in medical education program teaching roles who do not examine patients or prescribe controlled substances. - Amends TCA Section 63-1-402.
5966.description: As introduced, creates an exception to the two-hour biennial continuing education requirement related to controlled substance prescribing for licensed prescribers in medical education program teaching roles who do not examine patients or prescribe controlled substances. - Amends TCA Section 63-1-402.

5979.title: As introduced, allows persons pardoned by the governor for nonviolent crimes committed before January 1, 1980, to have the public records involving the crime expunged upon filing a petition. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 28 and Title 40, Chapter 32.
5979.description: As introduced, allows persons pardoned by the governor for nonviolent crimes committed before January 1, 1980, to have the public records involving the crime expunged upon filing a petition. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 28 and Title 40, Chapter 32.

5995.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5995.title: As introduced, extends the deadline from 10 days to 15 days by which a state agency releasing public records originating in the office of a county property assessor must notify the property assessor of the release. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 10, Chapter 7.
5995.description: As introduced, extends the deadline from 10 days to 15 days by which a state agency releasing public records originating in the office of a county property assessor must notify the property assessor of the release. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 10, Chapter 7.

6076.title: As introduced, prohibits local governments from reducing the post-employment benefits of retired employees without the written consent of the employee; prohibits local governments from raising premiums for such benefit plans at a rate that exceeds the average annual rate of inflation. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 56.
6076.description: As introduced, prohibits local governments from reducing the post-employment benefits of retired employees without the written consent of the employee; prohibits local governments from raising premiums for such benefit plans at a rate that exceeds the average annual rate of inflation. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 56.

6078.title: As introduced, authorizes the creation of first responder treatment court programs; creates a $50.00 fee for drug-related criminal convictions in counties establishing or operating a first responder treatment court program. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 4 and Title 16.
6078.description: As introduced, authorizes the creation of first responder treatment court programs; creates a $50.00 fee for drug-related criminal convictions in counties establishing or operating a first responder treatment court program. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 4 and Title 16.

6081.title: As introduced, allows a voter to take photographs or videos of only the voter’s marked ballot on a mobile electronic or communication device in a polling place; authorizes poll watchers and election officials to prohibit any disruptive activity that threatens the voting process or the privacy of a voter. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-142.
6081.description: As introduced, allows a voter to take photographs or videos of only the voter’s marked ballot on a mobile electronic or communication device in a polling place; authorizes poll watchers and election officials to prohibit any disruptive activity that threatens the voting process or the privacy of a voter. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-142.

6090.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
6090.title: As introduced, reduces the annual filing fee for limited liability companies from at least $300 to $20.00. - Amends TCA Title 48.
6090.description: As introduced, reduces the annual filing fee for limited liability companies from at least $300 to $20.00. - Amends TCA Title 48.

6238.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Judiciary Committee
6238.title: As introduced, adds correctional counselors employed by the department of correction to those authorized to carry firearms as law enforcement, at all times and in places in Tennessee with certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
6238.description: As introduced, adds correctional counselors employed by the department of correction to those authorized to carry firearms as law enforcement, at all times and in places in Tennessee with certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

6318.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
6318.title: As introduced, makes it an unfair and deceptive act or practice under the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act of 1977 for a person engaged in the sale or distribution of vapor products to not include a warning label stating certain health and safety risks on vapor products sold to customers in this state. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 33; Title 39; Title 47; Title 49; Title 63 and Title 68.
6318.description: As introduced, makes it an unfair and deceptive act or practice under the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act of 1977 for a person engaged in the sale or distribution of vapor products to not include a warning label stating certain health and safety risks on vapor products sold to customers in this state. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 33; Title 39; Title 47; Title 49; Title 63 and Title 68.

6326.title: As introduced, makes it an unfair or deceptive act under the Consumer Protection Act of 1977, for cell phone service providers to fail to provide an existing customer with a written summary of charges to sign before entering into a new or modified plan for cell phone service. - Amends TCA Title 12; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 65.
6326.description: As introduced, makes it an unfair or deceptive act under the Consumer Protection Act of 1977, for cell phone service providers to fail to provide an existing customer with a written summary of charges to sign before entering into a new or modified plan for cell phone service. - Amends TCA Title 12; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 65.

6331.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
6331.title: As introduced, authorizes absentee ballot counting boards to begin to tabulate the results of early and absentee voting at the time the polls are statutorily required to close, even if voters in the county are still waiting in line to vote; requires the absentee ballot counting board to publicly announce the results immediately upon the completion of the tabulation. - Amends TCA Title 2.
6331.description: As introduced, authorizes absentee ballot counting boards to begin to tabulate the results of early and absentee voting at the time the polls are statutorily required to close, even if voters in the county are still waiting in line to vote; requires the absentee ballot counting board to publicly announce the results immediately upon the completion of the tabulation. - Amends TCA Title 2.

6335.title: As introduced, authorizes the operation of off-highway vehicles on segments of U.S. Highway 25W (State Route 9) in the City of LaFollette in Campbell County. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-185.
6335.description: As introduced, authorizes the operation of off-highway vehicles on segments of U.S. Highway 25W (State Route 9) in the City of LaFollette in Campbell County. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-185.

6357.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
6357.title: As introduced, extends the amount of time, from 10 days to 30 days, that a real estate licensee or real estate licensee applicant has to respond to a complaint attempting to institute disciplinary action by the Tennessee real estate commission against the licensee or applicant. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.
6357.description: As introduced, extends the amount of time, from 10 days to 30 days, that a real estate licensee or real estate licensee applicant has to respond to a complaint attempting to institute disciplinary action by the Tennessee real estate commission against the licensee or applicant. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.

6372.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
6372.title: As introduced, authorizes TRICOR to enter contractual agreements with county jails to provide work training programs for prisoners incarcerated in county jails. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4.
6372.description: As introduced, authorizes TRICOR to enter contractual agreements with county jails to provide work training programs for prisoners incarcerated in county jails. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4.

6408.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6408.title: As introduced, changes the standard for when a court may terminate parental rights to a child who was conceived as the result of one parent's rape of the other parent from a criminal conviction to clear and convincing evidence that the rape occurred. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1, Part 1.
6408.description: As introduced, changes the standard for when a court may terminate parental rights to a child who was conceived as the result of one parent's rape of the other parent from a criminal conviction to clear and convincing evidence that the rape occurred. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1, Part 1.

6522.title: As introduced, encourages local boards of education to develop partnerships with nonprofit youth leadership and development organizations in their community to permit the use of school buildings and school property at a reduced fee or at no cost to the nonprofit organization. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.
6522.description: As introduced, encourages local boards of education to develop partnerships with nonprofit youth leadership and development organizations in their community to permit the use of school buildings and school property at a reduced fee or at no cost to the nonprofit organization. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

6555.title: As introduced, enacts the "Opioid Addiction Recovery Program for Pregnant Women and Women with Newborns Act," - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 33; Title 37; Title 49; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
6555.description: As introduced, enacts the "Opioid Addiction Recovery Program for Pregnant Women and Women with Newborns Act," - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 33; Title 37; Title 49; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

6586.title: As introduced, authorizes qualified aliens enumerated in federal law to apply for a funeral director's license. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-305.
6586.description: As introduced, authorizes qualified aliens enumerated in federal law to apply for a funeral director's license. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-305.

6600.title: As introduced, revises evaluation systems for teachers and other licensed school personnel; enacts a continuing contract law in lieu of the current tenure system. - Amends TCA Title 49.
6600.description: As introduced, revises evaluation systems for teachers and other licensed school personnel; enacts a continuing contract law in lieu of the current tenure system. - Amends TCA Title 49.

6602.title: As introduced, requires the department of commerce and insurance to develop a common summary of payments form for use by carriers and provided to insureds with respect to provider claims submitted to a payer; specifies the manner in which carriers can offer delivery of the summary to certain individuals; requires the department to issue guidance and provide, in collaboration with the department of health, education to providers and consumers on these requirements. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.
6602.description: As introduced, requires the department of commerce and insurance to develop a common summary of payments form for use by carriers and provided to insureds with respect to provider claims submitted to a payer; specifies the manner in which carriers can offer delivery of the summary to certain individuals; requires the department to issue guidance and provide, in collaboration with the department of health, education to providers and consumers on these requirements. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

6603.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
6603.title: As introduced, prohibits a direct-to-consumer genetic testing business entity from sharing personally identifiable genetic test data or other personally identifiable information about a consumer with a third party without the express written consent of the consumer or a subpoena or court order. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 29; Title 39; Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.
6603.description: As introduced, prohibits a direct-to-consumer genetic testing business entity from sharing personally identifiable genetic test data or other personally identifiable information about a consumer with a third party without the express written consent of the consumer or a subpoena or court order. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 29; Title 39; Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

6604.title: As introduced, requires the department of education to make annual financial reports from each public charter school available to the public by posting the reports to the department's website; requires public charter schools to provide information on all funds received by the public charter school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
6604.description: As introduced, requires the department of education to make annual financial reports from each public charter school available to the public by posting the reports to the department's website; requires public charter schools to provide information on all funds received by the public charter school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

6605.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
6605.title: As introduced, adds authorization to use a photo identification card issued by an accredited public postsecondary institution of education in this state for purposes of verifying the identity of an eligible voter. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.
6605.description: As introduced, adds authorization to use a photo identification card issued by an accredited public postsecondary institution of education in this state for purposes of verifying the identity of an eligible voter. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

6622.title: As introduced, removes salary for board of parole members; authorizes payment of travel expenses only for members who attend parole hearings and board meetings. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 28.
6622.description: As introduced, removes salary for board of parole members; authorizes payment of travel expenses only for members who attend parole hearings and board meetings. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 28.

6638.title: As introduced, creates the Tennessee violence intervention program within the TBI to invest in evidence-based violence reduction initiatives. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6; Title 39 and Title 40.
6638.description: As introduced, creates the Tennessee violence intervention program within the TBI to invest in evidence-based violence reduction initiatives. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6; Title 39 and Title 40.

6659.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
6659.title: As introduced, exempts an LEA from having to assign a student to alternative school if the student is suspended for 10 days or less. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
6659.description: As introduced, exempts an LEA from having to assign a student to alternative school if the student is suspended for 10 days or less. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

6670.title: As introduced, requires the state board of education to adopt a policy that ensures uniform administration of unpaid meal charges in LEAs and guarantees that students are not prevented from receiving nutritious meals because of an unpaid meal charge. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
6670.description: As introduced, requires the state board of education to adopt a policy that ensures uniform administration of unpaid meal charges in LEAs and guarantees that students are not prevented from receiving nutritious meals because of an unpaid meal charge. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

6707.title: As introduced, requires the placement of a monument or statue honoring David Crockett on the pedestal above the entrance to Motlow Tunnel on Charlotte Avenue; requires the State Capitol Commission to determine an appropriate site on capitol grounds for the relocation of the statue of Edward Carmack. - Amends TCA Title 4.
6707.description: As introduced, requires the placement of a monument or statue honoring David Crockett on the pedestal above the entrance to Motlow Tunnel on Charlotte Avenue; requires the State Capitol Commission to determine an appropriate site on capitol grounds for the relocation of the statue of Edward Carmack. - Amends TCA Title 4.

6733.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
6733.title: As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to notify each LEA when the office of research and education accountability publishes a report germane to K-12 education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
6733.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to notify each LEA when the office of research and education accountability publishes a report germane to K-12 education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

6743.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
6743.title: As introduced, makes appropriations for educator preparation programs for the fiscal years beginning July 1, 2019, and July 1, 2020. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 49.
6743.description: As introduced, makes appropriations for educator preparation programs for the fiscal years beginning July 1, 2019, and July 1, 2020. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 49.

6745.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6745.title: As introduced, requires a court, in setting bail for a defendant charged with driving under the influence of an intoxicant or another alcohol-related offense, to require the person to operate only a motor vehicle equipped with a functioning ignition interlock device; requires the defendant to submit proof of compliance to the district attorney general's office within 10 days of release. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.
6745.description: As introduced, requires a court, in setting bail for a defendant charged with driving under the influence of an intoxicant or another alcohol-related offense, to require the person to operate only a motor vehicle equipped with a functioning ignition interlock device; requires the defendant to submit proof of compliance to the district attorney general's office within 10 days of release. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.

6746.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6746.title: As introduced, makes various changes to the application and renewal process for concealed handgun carry permits. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
6746.description: As introduced, makes various changes to the application and renewal process for concealed handgun carry permits. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

6756.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Transportation & Safety Committee
6756.title: As introduced, expands tire pre-disposal fee program to sales of used tires; expands purposes for which certain revenues from the program may be expended. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 16 and Title 68.
6756.description: As introduced, expands tire pre-disposal fee program to sales of used tires; expands purposes for which certain revenues from the program may be expended. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 16 and Title 68.

6798.title: As introduced, requires that a court determine that a sexual offender presents a danger of substantial harm to a child prior to prohibiting the sexual offender from conducting an overnight visit at a residence in which the offender's child resides or is present. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Section 40-39-211.
6798.description: As introduced, requires that a court determine that a sexual offender presents a danger of substantial harm to a child prior to prohibiting the sexual offender from conducting an overnight visit at a residence in which the offender's child resides or is present. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Section 40-39-211.

6814.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
6814.title: As introduced, specifies that state food safety laws do not require persons licensed as custom meat processors who process any amenable species to comply with federal regulations promulgated under the federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act for good manufacturing, hazard analysis, and risk-based preventive controls. - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 53.
6814.description: As introduced, specifies that state food safety laws do not require persons licensed as custom meat processors who process any amenable species to comply with federal regulations promulgated under the federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act for good manufacturing, hazard analysis, and risk-based preventive controls. - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 53.

6967.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
6967.title: As introduced, enacts the "Local School District Empowerment Act," which creates a pilot program for reestablishment of the office of elected school superintendent; requires the department of education to study the pilot program procedures for reestablishment of the office; adjusts duties of local boards of education in systems in which the office of elected school superintendent is reestablished. - Amends TCA Title 49.
6967.description: As introduced, enacts the "Local School District Empowerment Act," which creates a pilot program for reestablishment of the office of elected school superintendent; requires the department of education to study the pilot program procedures for reestablishment of the office; adjusts duties of local boards of education in systems in which the office of elected school superintendent is reestablished. - Amends TCA Title 49.

7036.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
7036.title: As introduced, authorizes a handgun permit holder to notify the department of safety of a change of address through electronic means. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.
7036.description: As introduced, authorizes a handgun permit holder to notify the department of safety of a change of address through electronic means. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

7098.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
7098.title: As introduced, expands the type of equipment for which law enforcement agencies and drug task forces may exchange confiscated weapons to include any equipment suitable for use for legitimate law enforcement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
7098.description: As introduced, expands the type of equipment for which law enforcement agencies and drug task forces may exchange confiscated weapons to include any equipment suitable for use for legitimate law enforcement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

7109.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
7109.title: As introduced, requires the department to create meaningful incentives and rewards for schools placed in reward status; defines "meaningful incentives and rewards" to include prioritizing grant applications submitted to the department by reward schools; specifies that acts solely of recognition or celebration are not "meaningful incentives and rewards." - Amends TCA Title 49.
7109.description: As introduced, requires the department to create meaningful incentives and rewards for schools placed in reward status; defines "meaningful incentives and rewards" to include prioritizing grant applications submitted to the department by reward schools; specifies that acts solely of recognition or celebration are not "meaningful incentives and rewards." - Amends TCA Title 49.

7174.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
7174.title: As introduced, requires the department to approve or reject an application for assistance from certain programs administered by the department within 10 business days of receipt of the application, and to provide the requested assistance within 10 business days of approval of the application. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.
7174.description: As introduced, requires the department to approve or reject an application for assistance from certain programs administered by the department within 10 business days of receipt of the application, and to provide the requested assistance within 10 business days of approval of the application. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.

7277.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
7277.title: As introduced, clarifies that the departments of health and human services joint annual report regarding options under medicaid and temporary assistance for needy families must also be provided to legislative reference, law library, and the speaker of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 9; Title 68 and Title 71.
7277.description: As introduced, clarifies that the departments of health and human services joint annual report regarding options under medicaid and temporary assistance for needy families must also be provided to legislative reference, law library, and the speaker of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 9; Title 68 and Title 71.

7297.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Government Operations Committee
7297.title: As introduced, restructures the advisory council on the commercial explosives industry. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 105.
7297.description: As introduced, restructures the advisory council on the commercial explosives industry. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 105.

7404.title: As introduced, requires a county administrator of elections to make available to that county's election commissioners all election-related information held by the county administrator of elections during regular business hours; requires the state election commission to promulgate rules providing standard operating procedures regarding election day procedures and chain of custody of election records. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11 and Title 2, Chapter 12.
7404.description: As introduced, requires a county administrator of elections to make available to that county's election commissioners all election-related information held by the county administrator of elections during regular business hours; requires the state election commission to promulgate rules providing standard operating procedures regarding election day procedures and chain of custody of election records. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11 and Title 2, Chapter 12.

7405.title: As introduced, prohibits the use of weighted voting, the use of barcodes and Quick Response codes on ballots, and any other type of fractional cumulative voting in statewide and local elections in this state; requires the administrator of elections of each county to implement a biennial review system for purposes of compliance and certify compliance to the coordinator of elections. - Amends TCA Title 2.
7405.description: As introduced, prohibits the use of weighted voting, the use of barcodes and Quick Response codes on ballots, and any other type of fractional cumulative voting in statewide and local elections in this state; requires the administrator of elections of each county to implement a biennial review system for purposes of compliance and certify compliance to the coordinator of elections. - Amends TCA Title 2.

7412.title: As introduced, requires the board of parole, in making a parole determination for an offender convicted of a homicide, to consider whether the offender continues to obstruct the ability of law enforcement to recover the remains of the victim; enacts the "Joe Clyde Daniels Act." - Amends TCA Title 40.
7412.description: As introduced, requires the board of parole, in making a parole determination for an offender convicted of a homicide, to consider whether the offender continues to obstruct the ability of law enforcement to recover the remains of the victim; enacts the "Joe Clyde Daniels Act." - Amends TCA Title 40.

7483.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
7483.title: As introduced, requires the office of research and education accountability to also report its findings annually to the governor concerning its research, analyses, evaluations, and other projects. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 49.
7483.description: As introduced, requires the office of research and education accountability to also report its findings annually to the governor concerning its research, analyses, evaluations, and other projects. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 49.

7602.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Commerce & Labor Committee
7602.title: As introduced, establishes the legal nature of digital assets within existing law, including the Uniform Commercial Code, and classifies such assets into categories of intangible personal property. - Amends TCA Title 32; Title 34; Title 35; Title 39; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.
7602.description: As introduced, establishes the legal nature of digital assets within existing law, including the Uniform Commercial Code, and classifies such assets into categories of intangible personal property. - Amends TCA Title 32; Title 34; Title 35; Title 39; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.

7715.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Judiciary Committee
7715.title: As introduced, requires that the notice of a potential claim for healthcare liability that is based on alleged exposure to or contraction of coronavirus include the date and location of the alleged exposure or contraction. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 9; Title 20; Title 28; Title 29 and Title 49.
7715.description: As introduced, requires that the notice of a potential claim for healthcare liability that is based on alleged exposure to or contraction of coronavirus include the date and location of the alleged exposure or contraction. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 9; Title 20; Title 28; Title 29 and Title 49.
